Responsibilities include:
Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn how to build and move to production grade AWS environments that support Amazon Connect
Solutions - Define and deliver on-site Professional Services engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements, specifically focused on call center organization, processes, tooling and integration. Software development experience with building contact center integrations is a plus.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include integration and adaption of existing enterprise call centers into Amazon Connect.
Insights - Work with AWS product, engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Contribute to best practice in the form of whitepapers and playbooks.
Partnering Work with new vendors to help them become MSPs and enable and upskill existing partners.This is a customer facing role.
This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations will be required to deliver professional services when needed.
Basic qualifications
Bachelor's degree required
10+ years of experience as a contact center technology architect, enterprise IT Architect or senior contact center developer working with leading contact center technology platforms and applications, such as Avaya, Cisco, Genesys, Verint, NICE, Salesforce, etc.
Hands-on technical practitioner and individual contributor
Hands-on experience working on the design, development and deployment of contact center solutions at scale
Preferred qualifications

10+ years of experience building call center / collaboration / telephony platforms in a Cloud or On-Premises environment, particularly building application integration capabilities for CRM/ WFM platforms
Professional Services or Consulting experience in highly-visible customer-facing roles

tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Amazon Aws  Devops  Scrum  Agile  Continuous Integration  Cloud  Itil  Service Delivery  Account Management  Risk Management  Compliance  Consulting  Facilitation
job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, and headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Sourced Group is the market leader in providing cloud transformation services to the most highly regulated, security-conscious organizations globally. With operations in Australia, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, New Zealand, and the United States, we work with the Global 200 to drive business transformation through the cloud and I.T. services. Sourced Group is an AWS Premier Partner, Microsoft Azure Gold Managed Partner, Google Premier Partner and have worked with extensive financial services and regulated enterprises such as the top banks in Canada, Australia and Singapore, as well as airlines and telecommunications companies. After recent successes, Sourced Group is continuing to expand its footprint around the world. Sourced was acquired this year by Amdocs.
Sourced Values
Here at Sourced, we are committed to providing a rewarding, enjoyable, balanced workplace and career path for our employees. We value authentic, self-driven people, who aspire to grow personally and professionally, and are committed to delivering excellence in all areas.
Our company Values are Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, and Sustainability.
Role
The Lead Delivery Consultant position offers an excellent career and growth opportunity for a talented and highly-motivated professional with significant prior experience in operations, management consulting and technical cloud operations. This role is part of a newly formed Solutions Enablement team in Singapore.
Sourced is a company that makes a tremendous impact and has specific knowledge and experience working in sophisticated, often complicated, and generally extensive, regulated environments. Our people are fearless and work in partnership with both client leadership and engineering teams to build world-class public cloud solutions in regulated and security-conscious verticals.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Enablement, this newly created position is responsible for leading agile cloud transformation projects for customers in ASEAN.
As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we need passionate leaders to help our largest customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud platform operations. You will work one-on-one with our top-tier customers and partners, supporting not only the software development lifecycle as it applies to the cloud services but also the operations management of active services, and business relationships between the Customer, Sourced Group, and partners (such as Microsoft, AWS, and application development partners).
As a Lead Agile Delivery Consultant, you will be the primary operational point of contact for one or more customers, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business-critical applications. Whilst this role is business-focused, you will coordinate technical teams to deliver enterprise public cloud projects (with AWS, Azure and GCP).
You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers to build mature, stable and secure operational cloud platforms. You will leverage your broad experience in management consulting focusing on the delivery of large-scale projects across industries such as Finance, Consumer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications.
You will also be responsible for driving Cloud change program into our clients and develop the Governance and Change Management offerings.
With your team of Delivery consultants, you will be our Cloud Consultants and Site leads advocate and you will support their workload by managing timelines, scope and customers expectations. You must possess customer-facing skills that enable you to represent the Sourced team, our capabilities, and our services within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. Each day will bring new challenges to which you will need to adapt and respond. Customer centricity, tenacity, and a sense of urgency will all contribute to your success in this role. You will:
Act with a sense of urgency, be agile and pragmatic, and foster cross-team collaboration;
Support the Head of Solutions Enablement, Head of Consulting and Head of Sales assist with account management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations with clients, and manage resource allocation
Supervise technical issues resolution, work directly with your team of delivery consultants, as well as escalate to subject-matter experts, and work directly with the cloud service provider(s) (GCP, AWS and Azure) to ensure customer issues are mitigated and resolved in an expeditious manner;
Facilitate discussions to ensure solutions are designed for long term successful deployment and operational stability;
As required, define I.T. and business processes and tools that work well with customers expectations to streamline the performance of the services which we provide;
Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans, as well as to provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, and detailed prelaunch planning;
Analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership, as well as roadmap and service improvement plans;
Desired Skills and Experience
While specific responsibilities will vary based on previous experience, to be successful in the role, the ideal candidate will have the following:
8 years plus of relevant experience in I.T. operations, consulting or related industry experience in digital transformation, preferably in verticals such as Financial services, Telecommunications or the Public sector.
Familiarity with Enterprise operations including ITSM, ITIL v3+, as well as SAFe/Scaled Agile and Agile product ownership & management (Scrum, Kanban, Sprints etc)
A natural problem-solving mindset, be detail-oriented with a creative flair and a bias for action
Relevant experience in project-based, team-oriented environments and a track record of leading or working in teams and delivering against tight deadlines in fast-paced and demanding environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to conduct and leverage sophisticated analyses to identify trends, draw conclusions and present recommendations.
Outstanding facilitation and communication skills; confidence in presenting to senior executives.
Graduate or advanced degree from a top academic program, ideally being a Bachelor's or Master degree in Business, Information Technology, or related field;
A thorough understanding of staffing, capacity planning, and performance engagement for internal teams
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Change Management principles as applied to service delivery in an international setting would be highly regarded.
Ability to lead scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases
If possible, the candidate would have large programs transformation experience, including cloud compliance, security and risk experience in regulated industries, especially the Financial and Services Industry.
Basic understanding of cloud computing. Understanding of DevOps practices would be a plus.
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, personalised career development plans, supportive management and team members, training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, global relocation packages, as well as a company bonus! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.
Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know

job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life.
The role: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
Our team inspires leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like G Suite, Search, and Chrome. You reach out proactively to show customers how Google Cloud solutions can help them become more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
Additional Role Description:
The Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales team focuses on business development in relation to small and medium-sized businesses, a critical segment for the Cloud business. The Sales team's priority is to maximize business growth from the SMB segment, predominantly through strategic pitching and advocacy, and cultivation of partners. The team also participates in research and experimentation with data-driven, scalable solutions intended to improve conversion rate and customer lifetime value.
As a Sales Representative focused on the Indonesian Market, you are an expert blend of sales, technology and strategy. Much of your time will be spent talking with customers, discussing and advocating for the value of Google Cloud solutions, particularly Google Workspace. In addition to having a passion for sales, you also possess analytical and creative skills. As you talk with many customers and partners each month, you will have ideas for how we can improve our product or enhance the customer experience.
In this role, you will manage new initiatives or experiments, while also using your ability to manage stakeholders across many different functional teams in order to execute quickly and to drive success. You will also work to develop the business growth of your assigned territory through campaigns, partner development and marketing events.
Responsibilities:
- Manage opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary. Serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption-related activities.
- Deliver against assigned strategic goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our customers.
- Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
- Work with our Sales Engineers and trusted Google Cloud Partners as a critical member of the Sales team in order to maximize business results and to cultivate opportunities with small and medium businesses.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience discussing platform and infrastructure-as-a-service
- Experience with the cloud computing market.
- Educate and advocate for Google and our products when presenting to Bahasa-speaking clients and agencies on new products, campaign results, and performance.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce.com). Demonstrated track record in reaching and exceeding strategic goals in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products.
- Technical or Sales Engineering experience in Computer Science or Information Systems.
- Technically minded, with an in-depth understanding of the technology and cloud computing market, and a passion for Google Cloud products (Workspace, Google Cloud Platform).
- Ability to build influential relationships and to deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
- Ability to effectively operate with enthusiasm and flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.

job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
There is no love sincerer than the love of food. - George Bernard Shaw
Do you love food and convenience put together Then you will definitely love foodpanda!
foodpanda (small f) is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
However, this doesn't happen without some really awesome people. We are looking for a Principal Engineer (Tech Lead), based in our exciting Singapore office to support our growing regional Product and Engineering team that is also based in Singapore. You will be part of an international team of highly talented and motivated people.
As Principal Engineer, you will be working closely with our central product team based in Berlin. You will be a leader at the forefront, as this role would require strong collaboration across various technology teams. You will be responsible for building a new product solving real-life problems for our restaurant partners and contact centre. We are developing a new menu management product which plugs in with our existing restaurant portal which is based on plug-in architecture. This is a new role and you will be the first person to be hired as part of the engineering team in Singapore. In this role, you will be responsible for developing the architecture of the overall technology stack best suited for the product.
Over the next 12 months you will:
You will be responsible for hiring and building up the pioneer engineering team
You will work closely with the central product team based in Berlin and collectively identify the best tech stack for the product.
You will design, develop and release MVP of the product.
You will work closely with the existing product team based out of Singapore.
You will gain fantastic exposure to scaling a tech team at a unique pace
Required Experience:
At least 12 years of Engineering experience with at least 3 years experience managing a team

Experience with cloud computing (AWS and/or GCP)

AWS clouds and the relevant DevOps services and tools
Experience with designing and architecture of microservices and distributed systems
Event-Driven architecture and DDD are a plus
Experience in software shipping cycles (dev, deploy, release, CI) and open-source software dev
Well versed in agile methodology
Comfortable with a customer-focused, high paced environment
Agile, DevOps, Software Craftsmanship: Scrum/Kanban, CI / CD, code optimization for performance and maintenance, bug management in production,
Back-end: GoLang is preferred but others are relevant as well but, Java, Python, Node.js also preferred
Knowledge of the whole web stack, understand how all the pieces fit together (front-end, web server, load balancer, database, network layer, etc.)
Immediate availability strongly preferred

A dynamic and challenging working environment
An extra steep learning curve
Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company
A vibrant and international team with a diverse background
Regular company and team events

job_description:
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs
The DevOps operating model is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that helps organizations deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. The Senior DevOps Consultant is a leader with significant automation and programming experience throughout the SDLC. The Consultant will lead our enterprise customers through large organizational and SDLC transformations. A successful DevOps practitioner has technical depth across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovations. Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants may be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic qualifications
8+ years of experience as a technical specialist.
Familiarity with administrative tasks within popular operating systems.
Hands-on experience with architecting and automated provisioning (IaC), configuration management for infrastructure and applications.
Hands-on experience with envisioning, designing, building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools.
Strong hands-on experience with mainline programming and scripting languages such as Shell, Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, .Net, or C++.
Experience establishing, implementing, and delivering using Agile practices.
Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience.
Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services as needed.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with CloudFormation, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.
Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall.
Experience with monitoring and log aggregating frameworks like CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Opentracing, AWS X-Ray, and APM tools.
Experience with development and automated testing.
Understanding of microservices and distributed application architecture.
Experience building enterprise security strategy for cloud adoption or driving the program's evolution to meet new requirements.
Experience leading the certification or accreditation of cloud workload(s) to meet industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks.
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations and engagements.

At AWS, we're hiring experienced consultants with a background in enterprise call centers to help our enterprise customers understand, plan and implement best practices around migrating, building, managing and operating Amazon Connect within their AWS cloud environments. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, re-usable artifacts, reference architectures, and lead implementation projects to assist some of the world's leading enterprises transform their call centers to Amazon Connect and the AWS platform.

Working on the cutting edge of innovative AWS products and services

Software development experience with building contact center integrations is a plus.

Insights - Work with AWS product, engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Contribute to best practice in the form of whitepapers and playbooks.

tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Amazon Aws  Devops  Scrum  Agile  Continuous Integration  Cloud  Itil  Service Delivery  Account Management  Risk Management  Compliance  Consulting  Facilitation
job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, and headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Sourced Group is the market leader in providing cloud transformation services to the most highly regulated, security-conscious organizations globally. With operations in Australia, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, New Zealand, and the United States, we work with the Global 200 to drive business transformation through the cloud and I.T. services. Sourced Group is an AWS Premier Partner, Microsoft Azure Gold Managed Partner, Google Premier Partner and have worked with extensive financial services and regulated enterprises such as the top banks in Canada, Australia and Singapore, as well as airlines and telecommunications companies. After recent successes, Sourced Group is continuing to expand its footprint around the world. Sourced was acquired this year by Amdocs.
Sourced Values
Here at Sourced, we are committed to providing a rewarding, enjoyable, balanced workplace and career path for our employees. We value authentic, self-driven people, who aspire to grow personally and professionally, and are committed to delivering excellence in all areas.
Our company Values are Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, and Sustainability.
Role
The Lead Delivery Consultant position offers an excellent career and growth opportunity for a talented and highly-motivated professional with significant prior experience in operations, management consulting and technical cloud operations. This role is part of a newly formed Solutions Enablement team in Singapore.
Sourced is a company that makes a tremendous impact and has specific knowledge and experience working in sophisticated, often complicated, and generally extensive, regulated environments. Our people are fearless and work in partnership with both client leadership and engineering teams to build world-class public cloud solutions in regulated and security-conscious verticals.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Enablement, this newly created position is responsible for leading agile cloud transformation projects for customers in ASEAN.
As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we need passionate leaders to help our largest customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud platform operations. You will work one-on-one with our top-tier customers and partners, supporting not only the software development lifecycle as it applies to the cloud services but also the operations management of active services, and business relationships between the Customer, Sourced Group, and partners (such as Microsoft, AWS, and application development partners).
As a Lead Agile Delivery Consultant, you will be the primary operational point of contact for one or more customers, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business-critical applications. Whilst this role is business-focused, you will coordinate technical teams to deliver enterprise public cloud projects (with AWS, Azure and GCP).
You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers to build mature, stable and secure operational cloud platforms. You will leverage your broad experience in management consulting focusing on the delivery of large-scale projects across industries such as Finance, Consumer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications.
You will also be responsible for driving Cloud change program into our clients and develop the Governance and Change Management offerings.
With your team of Delivery consultants, you will be our Cloud Consultants and Site leads advocate and you will support their workload by managing timelines, scope and customers expectations. You must possess customer-facing skills that enable you to represent the Sourced team, our capabilities, and our services within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. Each day will bring new challenges to which you will need to adapt and respond. Customer centricity, tenacity, and a sense of urgency will all contribute to your success in this role. You will:
Act with a sense of urgency, be agile and pragmatic, and foster cross-team collaboration;
Support the Head of Solutions Enablement, Head of Consulting and Head of Sales assist with account management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations with clients, and manage resource allocation
Supervise technical issues resolution, work directly with your team of delivery consultants, as well as escalate to subject-matter experts, and work directly with the cloud service provider(s) (GCP, AWS and Azure) to ensure customer issues are mitigated and resolved in an expeditious manner;
Facilitate discussions to ensure solutions are designed for long term successful deployment and operational stability;
As required, define I.T. and business processes and tools that work well with customers expectations to streamline the performance of the services which we provide;
Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans, as well as to provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, and detailed prelaunch planning;
Analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership, as well as roadmap and service improvement plans;
Desired Skills and Experience
While specific responsibilities will vary based on previous experience, to be successful in the role, the ideal candidate will have the following:
8 years plus of relevant experience in I.T. operations, consulting or related industry experience in digital transformation, preferably in verticals such as Financial services, Telecommunications or the Public sector.
Familiarity with Enterprise operations including ITSM, ITIL v3+, as well as SAFe/Scaled Agile and Agile product ownership & management (Scrum, Kanban, Sprints etc)
A natural problem-solving mindset, be detail-oriented with a creative flair and a bias for action
Relevant experience in project-based, team-oriented environments and a track record of leading or working in teams and delivering against tight deadlines in fast-paced and demanding environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to conduct and leverage sophisticated analyses to identify trends, draw conclusions and present recommendations.
Outstanding facilitation and communication skills; confidence in presenting to senior executives.
Graduate or advanced degree from a top academic program, ideally being a Bachelor's or Master degree in Business, Information Technology, or related field;
A thorough understanding of staffing, capacity planning, and performance engagement for internal teams
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Change Management principles as applied to service delivery in an international setting would be highly regarded.
Ability to lead scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases
If possible, the candidate would have large programs transformation experience, including cloud compliance, security and risk experience in regulated industries, especially the Financial and Services Industry.
Basic understanding of cloud computing. Understanding of DevOps practices would be a plus.
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, personalised career development plans, supportive management and team members, training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, global relocation packages, as well as a company bonus! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.
Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know

job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life.
The role: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
Our team inspires leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like G Suite, Search, and Chrome. You reach out proactively to show customers how Google Cloud solutions can help them become more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
Additional Role Description:
The Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales team focuses on business development in relation to small and medium-sized businesses, a critical segment for the Cloud business. The Sales team's priority is to maximize business growth from the SMB segment, predominantly through strategic pitching and advocacy, and cultivation of partners. The team also participates in research and experimentation with data-driven, scalable solutions intended to improve conversion rate and customer lifetime value.
As a Sales Representative focused on the Indonesian Market, you are an expert blend of sales, technology and strategy. Much of your time will be spent talking with customers, discussing and advocating for the value of Google Cloud solutions, particularly Google Workspace. In addition to having a passion for sales, you also possess analytical and creative skills. As you talk with many customers and partners each month, you will have ideas for how we can improve our product or enhance the customer experience.
In this role, you will manage new initiatives or experiments, while also using your ability to manage stakeholders across many different functional teams in order to execute quickly and to drive success. You will also work to develop the business growth of your assigned territory through campaigns, partner development and marketing events.
Responsibilities:
- Manage opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary. Serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption-related activities.
- Deliver against assigned strategic goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our customers.
- Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
- Work with our Sales Engineers and trusted Google Cloud Partners as a critical member of the Sales team in order to maximize business results and to cultivate opportunities with small and medium businesses.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience discussing platform and infrastructure-as-a-service
- Experience with the cloud computing market.
- Educate and advocate for Google and our products when presenting to Bahasa-speaking clients and agencies on new products, campaign results, and performance.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce.com). Demonstrated track record in reaching and exceeding strategic goals in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products.
- Technical or Sales Engineering experience in Computer Science or Information Systems.
- Technically minded, with an in-depth understanding of the technology and cloud computing market, and a passion for Google Cloud products (Workspace, Google Cloud Platform).
- Ability to build influential relationships and to deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
- Ability to effectively operate with enthusiasm and flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.

There is no love sincerer than the love of food. - George Bernard Shaw

foodpanda (small f) is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
However, this doesn't happen without some really awesome people. We are looking for a Principal Engineer (Tech Lead), based in our exciting Singapore office to support our growing regional Product and Engineering team that is also based in Singapore. As Principal Engineer, you will be working closely with our central product team based in Berlin. You will be a leader at the forefront, as this role would require strong collaboration across various technology teams. job_description:
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs
The DevOps operating model is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that helps organizations deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. The Senior DevOps Consultant is a leader with significant automation and programming experience throughout the SDLC. The Consultant will lead our enterprise customers through large organizational and SDLC transformations. A successful DevOps practitioner has technical depth across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovations. Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants may be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic qualifications
8+ years of experience as a technical specialist.
Familiarity with administrative tasks within popular operating systems.
Hands-on experience with architecting and automated provisioning (IaC), configuration management for infrastructure and applications.
Hands-on experience with envisioning, designing, building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools.
Strong hands-on experience with mainline programming and scripting languages such as Shell, Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, .Net, or C++.
Experience establishing, implementing, and delivering using Agile practices.
Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience.
Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services as needed.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with CloudFormation, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.
Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall.
Experience with monitoring and log aggregating frameworks like CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Opentracing, AWS X-Ray, and APM tools.
Experience with development and automated testing.
Understanding of microservices and distributed application architecture.
Experience building enterprise security strategy for cloud adoption or driving the program's evolution to meet new requirements.
Experience leading the certification or accreditation of cloud workload(s) to meet industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks.
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations and engagements.

job_description:
Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster and at lower cost Do you have a background in enterprise call centers, and a passion for driving innovation into existing IT organizations Are you comfortable working on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high-impact projects blending the newest technology with existing operational methodologies and tooling Are you passionate about helping customers solve the people, organizational and process issues preventing them realizing the benefits of cloud

At AWS, we're hiring experienced consultants with a background in enterprise call centers to help our enterprise customers understand, plan and implement best practices around migrating, building, managing and operating Amazon Connect within their AWS cloud environments. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, re-usable artifacts, reference architectures, and lead implementation projects to assist some of the world's leading enterprises transform their call centers to Amazon Connect and the AWS platform.

We're looking for someone who is passionate about:
Working on the cutting edge of innovative AWS products and services
Maintaining domain knowledge and expertise in enterprise call centers, workforce management, Artificial Intelligence and CRM platforms
Implementing and extending frameworks and methodologies commonly used by enterprises to assess, migrate, and transform the call center experience
Architecting and building large-scale solutions, which integrate smoothly in cloud and hybrid operating models for supporting Amazon Connect
Providing guidance on the people, organizational, security and compliance aspects of transforming the contact center to the Cloud
Setting-up and configuring AWS services in-line with best practices
Coaching customers and partner teams to be self-sufficient
Responsibilities include:
Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn how to build and move to production grade AWS environments that support Amazon Connect
Solutions - Define and deliver on-site Professional Services engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements, specifically focused on call center organization, processes, tooling and integration. Software development experience with building contact center integrations is a plus.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include integration and adaption of existing enterprise call centers into Amazon Connect.
Insights - Work with AWS product, engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Contribute to best practice in the form of whitepapers and playbooks.
Partnering Work with new vendors to help them become MSPs and enable and upskill existing partners.This is a customer facing role.
This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations will be required to deliver professional services when needed.
Basic qualifications
Bachelor's degree required
10+ years of experience as a contact center technology architect, enterprise IT Architect or senior contact center developer working with leading contact center technology platforms and applications, such as Avaya, Cisco, Genesys, Verint, NICE, Salesforce, etc.
Hands-on technical practitioner and individual contributor
Hands-on experience working on the design, development and deployment of contact center solutions at scale
Preferred qualifications
Computer Science, Information Systems, or Engineering background preferred; Master's degree desired
10+ years of experience building call center / collaboration / telephony platforms in a Cloud or On-Premises environment, particularly building application integration capabilities for CRM/ WFM platforms
Professional Services or Consulting experience in highly-visible customer-facing roles
Familiarity with Amazon Connect capabilities, benefits, and required deployment skills
Visible IT Industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT call centers and infrastructure.
Enterprise call center / telecomm implementation and operations experience
Serverless development experience including complex integrations with Amazon Lex, Lambda, Redshift, Aurora, Kinesis and Dynamo DB
Software Development / DevOps experience with integrating contact center platforms, CRMs, WFMs and AI
Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Microsoft, IBM, Citrix, VMware, Oracle, HP, etc.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Responsibility for designing, implementing and operating contact centers or telecommunication infrastructures within an enterprise environment

tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Amazon Aws  Devops  Scrum  Agile  Continuous Integration  Cloud  Itil  Service Delivery  Account Management  Risk Management  Compliance  Consulting  Facilitation
job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, and headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Sourced Group is the market leader in providing cloud transformation services to the most highly regulated, security-conscious organizations globally. With operations in Australia, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, New Zealand, and the United States, we work with the Global 200 to drive business transformation through the cloud and I.T. services. Sourced Group is an AWS Premier Partner, Microsoft Azure Gold Managed Partner, Google Premier Partner and have worked with extensive financial services and regulated enterprises such as the top banks in Canada, Australia and Singapore, as well as airlines and telecommunications companies. After recent successes, Sourced Group is continuing to expand its footprint around the world. Sourced was acquired this year by Amdocs.
Sourced Values
Here at Sourced, we are committed to providing a rewarding, enjoyable, balanced workplace and career path for our employees. We value authentic, self-driven people, who aspire to grow personally and professionally, and are committed to delivering excellence in all areas.
Our company Values are Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, and Sustainability.
Role
The Lead Delivery Consultant position offers an excellent career and growth opportunity for a talented and highly-motivated professional with significant prior experience in operations, management consulting and technical cloud operations. This role is part of a newly formed Solutions Enablement team in Singapore.
Sourced is a company that makes a tremendous impact and has specific knowledge and experience working in sophisticated, often complicated, and generally extensive, regulated environments. Our people are fearless and work in partnership with both client leadership and engineering teams to build world-class public cloud solutions in regulated and security-conscious verticals.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Enablement, this newly created position is responsible for leading agile cloud transformation projects for customers in ASEAN.
As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we need passionate leaders to help our largest customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud platform operations. You will work one-on-one with our top-tier customers and partners, supporting not only the software development lifecycle as it applies to the cloud services but also the operations management of active services, and business relationships between the Customer, Sourced Group, and partners (such as Microsoft, AWS, and application development partners).
As a Lead Agile Delivery Consultant, you will be the primary operational point of contact for one or more customers, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business-critical applications. Whilst this role is business-focused, you will coordinate technical teams to deliver enterprise public cloud projects (with AWS, Azure and GCP).
You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers to build mature, stable and secure operational cloud platforms. You will leverage your broad experience in management consulting focusing on the delivery of large-scale projects across industries such as Finance, Consumer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications.
You will also be responsible for driving Cloud change program into our clients and develop the Governance and Change Management offerings.
With your team of Delivery consultants, you will be our Cloud Consultants and Site leads advocate and you will support their workload by managing timelines, scope and customers expectations. You must possess customer-facing skills that enable you to represent the Sourced team, our capabilities, and our services within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. Each day will bring new challenges to which you will need to adapt and respond. Customer centricity, tenacity, and a sense of urgency will all contribute to your success in this role. You will:
Act with a sense of urgency, be agile and pragmatic, and foster cross-team collaboration;
Support the Head of Solutions Enablement, Head of Consulting and Head of Sales assist with account management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations with clients, and manage resource allocation
Supervise technical issues resolution, work directly with your team of delivery consultants, as well as escalate to subject-matter experts, and work directly with the cloud service provider(s) (GCP, AWS and Azure) to ensure customer issues are mitigated and resolved in an expeditious manner;
Facilitate discussions to ensure solutions are designed for long term successful deployment and operational stability;
As required, define I.T. and business processes and tools that work well with customers expectations to streamline the performance of the services which we provide;
Engage with Director and C-Level executives to translate business needs into technical and operational plans, as well as to provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, and detailed prelaunch planning;
Analyze and present operational reviews to customer leadership, as well as roadmap and service improvement plans;
Desired Skills and Experience
While specific responsibilities will vary based on previous experience, to be successful in the role, the ideal candidate will have the following:
8 years plus of relevant experience in I.T. operations, consulting or related industry experience in digital transformation, preferably in verticals such as Financial services, Telecommunications or the Public sector.
Familiarity with Enterprise operations including ITSM, ITIL v3+, as well as SAFe/Scaled Agile and Agile product ownership & management (Scrum, Kanban, Sprints etc)
A natural problem-solving mindset, be detail-oriented with a creative flair and a bias for action
Relevant experience in project-based, team-oriented environments and a track record of leading or working in teams and delivering against tight deadlines in fast-paced and demanding environments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to conduct and leverage sophisticated analyses to identify trends, draw conclusions and present recommendations.
Outstanding facilitation and communication skills; confidence in presenting to senior executives.
Graduate or advanced degree from a top academic program, ideally being a Bachelor's or Master degree in Business, Information Technology, or related field;
A thorough understanding of staffing, capacity planning, and performance engagement for internal teams
Agile approach in personal work style, with ability to be flexible and adept in dealing with and resolving ambiguity
Change Management principles as applied to service delivery in an international setting would be highly regarded.
Ability to lead scoping and design sessions, sprint planning, client showcases
If possible, the candidate would have large programs transformation experience, including cloud compliance, security and risk experience in regulated industries, especially the Financial and Services Industry.
Basic understanding of cloud computing. Understanding of DevOps practices would be a plus.
Why Sourced
Sourced offers huge growth opportunities in?an innovative, collaborative and inclusive?environment. We have regular team social events, personalised career development plans, supportive management and team members, training budget to utilise every year, monthly educational workshops, global relocation packages, as well as a company bonus! We provide opportunities to work on challenging technology solutions, whilst encouraging and aiding the ongoing professional development of our team.
Sourced Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know

job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life.
The role: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
Our team inspires leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like G Suite, Search, and Chrome. You reach out proactively to show customers how Google Cloud solutions can help them become more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
Additional Role Description:
The Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales team focuses on business development in relation to small and medium-sized businesses, a critical segment for the Cloud business. The Sales team's priority is to maximize business growth from the SMB segment, predominantly through strategic pitching and advocacy, and cultivation of partners. The team also participates in research and experimentation with data-driven, scalable solutions intended to improve conversion rate and customer lifetime value.
As a Sales Representative focused on the Indonesian Market, you are an expert blend of sales, technology and strategy. Much of your time will be spent talking with customers, discussing and advocating for the value of Google Cloud solutions, particularly Google Workspace. In addition to having a passion for sales, you also possess analytical and creative skills. As you talk with many customers and partners each month, you will have ideas for how we can improve our product or enhance the customer experience.
In this role, you will manage new initiatives or experiments, while also using your ability to manage stakeholders across many different functional teams in order to execute quickly and to drive success. You will also work to develop the business growth of your assigned territory through campaigns, partner development and marketing events.
Responsibilities:
- Manage opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary. Serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption-related activities.
- Deliver against assigned strategic goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our customers.
- Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
- Work with our Sales Engineers and trusted Google Cloud Partners as a critical member of the Sales team in order to maximize business results and to cultivate opportunities with small and medium businesses.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience discussing platform and infrastructure-as-a-service
- Experience with the cloud computing market.
- Educate and advocate for Google and our products when presenting to Bahasa-speaking clients and agencies on new products, campaign results, and performance.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce.com). Demonstrated track record in reaching and exceeding strategic goals in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products.
- Technical or Sales Engineering experience in Computer Science or Information Systems.
- Technically minded, with an in-depth understanding of the technology and cloud computing market, and a passion for Google Cloud products (Workspace, Google Cloud Platform).
- Ability to build influential relationships and to deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
- Ability to effectively operate with enthusiasm and flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.

Roles & Responsibilities
There is no love sincerer than the love of food. - George Bernard Shaw
Do you love food and convenience put together Then you will definitely love foodpanda!
foodpanda (small f) is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
However, this doesn't happen without some really awesome people. We are looking for a Principal Engineer (Tech Lead), based in our exciting Singapore office to support our growing regional Product and Engineering team that is also based in Singapore. You will be part of an international team of highly talented and motivated people.
As Principal Engineer, you will be working closely with our central product team based in Berlin. You will be a leader at the forefront, as this role would require strong collaboration across various technology teams. You will be responsible for building a new product solving real-life problems for our restaurant partners and contact centre. We are developing a new menu management product which plugs in with our existing restaurant portal which is based on plug-in architecture. This is a new role and you will be the first person to be hired as part of the engineering team in Singapore. In this role, you will be responsible for developing the architecture of the overall technology stack best suited for the product.

job_description:
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs
The DevOps operating model is the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that helps organizations deliver end-to-end applications and infrastructure solutions safely and at high velocity. The Senior DevOps Consultant is a leader with significant automation and programming experience throughout the SDLC. The Consultant will lead our enterprise customers through large organizational and SDLC transformations. A successful DevOps practitioner has technical depth across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovations. Our Consultants work with enterprise customers locally, regionally and potentially domestically. As such, Consultants may be required to travel to client locations to sell and deliver professional services as needed.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Basic qualifications
8+ years of experience as a technical specialist.
Familiarity with administrative tasks within popular operating systems.
Hands-on experience with architecting and automated provisioning (IaC), configuration management for infrastructure and applications.
Hands-on experience with envisioning, designing, building and managing release systems, code merging and promotion, and CI/CD workflows and tools.
Strong hands-on experience with mainline programming and scripting languages such as Shell, Python, Ruby, Perl, Java, .Net, or C++.
Experience establishing, implementing, and delivering using Agile practices.
Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience.
Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services as needed.
Preferred qualifications
Experience with CloudFormation, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments.
Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall.
Experience with monitoring and log aggregating frameworks like CloudWatch, Datadog, Splunk, Opentracing, AWS X-Ray, and APM tools.
Experience with development and automated testing.
Understanding of microservices and distributed application architecture.
Experience building enterprise security strategy for cloud adoption or driving the program's evolution to meet new requirements.
Experience leading the certification or accreditation of cloud workload(s) to meet industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks.
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to lead effectively across organizations and engagements.

At AWS, we're hiring experienced consultants with a background in enterprise call centers to help our enterprise customers understand, plan and implement best practices around migrating, building, managing and operating Amazon Connect within their AWS cloud environments. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, re-usable artifacts, reference architectures, and lead implementation projects to assist some of the world's leading enterprises transform their call centers to Amazon Connect and the AWS platform.

Working on the cutting edge of innovative AWS products and services

Software development experience with building contact center integrations is a plus.

Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Contribute to best practice in the form of whitepapers and playbooks.

tech_stack: Cloud Computing  Amazon Aws  Devops  Scrum  Agile  Continuous Integration  Cloud  Itil  Service Delivery  Account Management  Risk Management  Compliance  Consulting  Facilitation
job_description:
About Sourced
Founded in Sydney, Australia, and headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Sourced Group is the market leader in providing cloud transformation services to the most highly regulated, security-conscious organizations globally. With operations in Australia, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, New Zealand, and the United States, we work with the Global 200 to drive business transformation through the cloud and I.T. services. Sourced Group is an AWS Premier Partner, Microsoft Azure Gold Managed Partner, Google Premier Partner and have worked with extensive financial services and regulated enterprises such as the top banks in Canada, Australia and Singapore, as well as airlines and telecommunications companies. After recent successes, Sourced Group is continuing to expand its footprint around the world. Sourced was acquired this year by Amdocs.
Sourced Values
Here at Sourced, we are committed to providing a rewarding, enjoyable, balanced workplace and career path for our employees. We value authentic, self-driven people, who aspire to grow personally and professionally, and are committed to delivering excellence in all areas.
Our company Values are Integrity, Innovation, Service, Quality, Humility, and Sustainability.
Role
The Lead Delivery Consultant position offers an excellent career and growth opportunity for a talented and highly-motivated professional with significant prior experience in operations, management consulting and technical cloud operations. This role is part of a newly formed Solutions Enablement team in Singapore.
Sourced is a company that makes a tremendous impact and has specific knowledge and experience working in sophisticated, often complicated, and generally extensive, regulated environments. Our people are fearless and work in partnership with both client leadership and engineering teams to build world-class public cloud solutions in regulated and security-conscious verticals.
Reporting to the Head of Solutions Enablement, this newly created position is responsible for leading agile cloud transformation projects for customers in ASEAN.
As an increasing number of large enterprises move their critical systems to the cloud, we need passionate leaders to help our largest customers navigate the operational challenges of cloud platform operations. You will work one-on-one with our top-tier customers and partners, supporting not only the software development lifecycle as it applies to the cloud services but also the operations management of active services, and business relationships between the Customer, Sourced Group, and partners (such as Microsoft, AWS, and application development partners).
As a Lead Agile Delivery Consultant, you will be the primary operational point of contact for one or more customers, helping to plan, review, and oversee ongoing operations of business-critical applications. Whilst this role is business-focused, you will coordinate technical teams to deliver enterprise public cloud projects (with AWS, Azure and GCP).
You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges as you help our customers to build mature, stable and secure operational cloud platforms. You will leverage your broad experience in management consulting focusing on the delivery of large-scale projects across industries such as Finance, Consumer, Technology, Media and Telecommunications.
You will also be responsible for driving Cloud change program into our clients and develop the Governance and Change Management offerings.
With your team of Delivery consultants, you will be our Cloud Consultants and Site leads advocate and you will support their workload by managing timelines, scope and customers expectations. You must possess customer-facing skills that enable you to represent the Sourced team, our capabilities, and our services within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding incidents, trade-offs, best practices, and risk management. Each day will bring new challenges to which you will need to adapt and respond. Customer centricity, tenacity, and a sense of urgency will all contribute to your success in this role. You will:
Act with a sense of urgency, be agile and pragmatic, and foster cross-team collaboration;
Support the Head of Solutions Enablement, Head of Consulting and Head of Sales assist with account management, developing statements of work and supporting commercial conversations with clients, and manage resource allocation

tech_stack: Scalability  Azure  Cloud Computing  Vmware  Vblock  Google Cloud Platform  Saas  Virtualization  CRM  Customer Experience  experimentation  Customer Contact  Sales Engineering  Advocacy  Audit
job_description:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life.
The role: Sales Representative, Small/Medium Businesses, Google Cloud - Singapore
Our team inspires leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like G Suite, Search, and Chrome. You reach out proactively to show customers how Google Cloud solutions can help them become more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You'll maintain relationships with clients and work cross-functionally to devise solutions and support for Google's clients.
Additional Role Description:
The Small- and Medium-sized Business (SMB) Sales team focuses on business development in relation to small and medium-sized businesses, a critical segment for the Cloud business. The Sales team's priority is to maximize business growth from the SMB segment, predominantly through strategic pitching and advocacy, and cultivation of partners. The team also participates in research and experimentation with data-driven, scalable solutions intended to improve conversion rate and customer lifetime value.
As a Sales Representative focused on the Indonesian Market, you are an expert blend of sales, technology and strategy. Much of your time will be spent talking with customers, discussing and advocating for the value of Google Cloud solutions, particularly Google Workspace. In addition to having a passion for sales, you also possess analytical and creative skills. As you talk with many customers and partners each month, you will have ideas for how we can improve our product or enhance the customer experience.
In this role, you will manage new initiatives or experiments, while also using your ability to manage stakeholders across many different functional teams in order to execute quickly and to drive success. You will also work to develop the business growth of your assigned territory through campaigns, partner development and marketing events.
Responsibilities:
- Manage opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary. Serve as the primary customer contact for all adoption-related activities.
- Deliver against assigned strategic goals while prioritizing an outstanding customer experience for our customers.
- Drive business development, forecast accurately and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
- Work with our Sales Engineers and trusted Google Cloud Partners as a critical member of the Sales team in order to maximize business results and to cultivate opportunities with small and medium businesses.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Experience discussing platform and infrastructure-as-a-service
- Experience with the cloud computing market.
- Educate and advocate for Google and our products when presenting to Bahasa-speaking clients and agencies on new products, campaign results, and performance.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience using CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce.com). Demonstrated track record in reaching and exceeding strategic goals in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products.
- Technical or Sales Engineering experience in Computer Science or Information Systems.
- Technically minded, with an in-depth understanding of the technology and cloud computing market, and a passion for Google Cloud products (Workspace, Google Cloud Platform).
- Ability to build influential relationships and to deliver results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
- Ability to effectively operate with enthusiasm and flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving team environment.
